data.title: Bangalore Green Line Metro Map Timing, Lines, Fact & Station
data.meta_description: Here is the list of all stations of Bangalore Metro Green Line with route map, timings, interchange stations and near by top attractions of metro station.
data.text:
Green Line (Namma Metro) is the second line of Bangalore Metro and the only one other than the Purple Line to be operational in the city presently.

Quick Info

Inaugurated in: 1 March 2014

Number of Stations: 32 Stations

Timings: 5:00 am to 11:00 pm

Ticket Price: Rs.10 to Rs.60

Bangalore Metro Green Line Route Map

Bangalore Metro Green Line Interesting Facts

The Bangalore Metro project was undertaken by the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL), a joint venture between the Government of India and the Government of Karnataka.

It runs along a route length of 30.69 km, almost like an arc connecting the northwestern and southwestern parts of the city; the line has 32 stations.

Green Line uses three-coach trains that travel at a maximum speed of over 65 km/h with a headway of 4 to 15 minutes.

Standard gauge (1435 mm) tracks and 750 V DC via third rail are used on the line.

Stations on Green Line

Station Interchange/Connections Accomodation Nagasandra Dasarahalli Jalahalli

Further Extension of Green Line

Under Bangalore Metro Phase II, Green Line is being elongated at both its termini. From Nagasandra, it will connect to the Bangalore International Exhibition Centre, while from Yelachenahalli, it will be extended to NICE Anjana Township.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. How many metro stations are on the Green Line?

A. Currently, the Green Line Bangalore Metro is running on 32 stations.

Q. Which is the 1st station on the Green Line metro in Bangalore?

A. Nagasandra and Silk Institute are the initial stations on the Green Line on both ends.

Q. Which is the most popular station on the Green Line metro in Bangalore?

A. The most popular stations on the Green Line are National College, Silk Institute, Yashwanthpur, and Majestic.

Q. Who made the Green Line metro in Bangalore?

A. Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation (BMRC) operates all the operations of Bangalore Metro.

Q. Which is the cleanest metro line in Bangalore?

A. The Bangalore Metro has made significant efforts to maintain cleanliness by implementing regular cleaning schedules, and waste management systems, and educating passengers about maintaining cleanliness inside the trains and stations.

Q. Which metro line is the longest in Bangalore?

A. The Purple Line is the longest with 39.4 km and 37 stations.

Q. What is the timing of the first train from a Green Line in Bangalore?

A. The first train departure time on the Green Line of the Bangalore Metro is 5:00 a.m.

Q. What is the timing of the last train from the Green Line in Bangalore?
